name: Colours for children
:LABEL: Curriculum
description: A colourful exploration of light frequencies for children

name: Color Matching and Sorting
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can match two objects of the same color when given a set of colored items;Child can sort objects into groups by color when given items of 2-3 different colors;Child can identify when two objects are the same color or different colors
description: Understanding color matching and sorting: Child can match two objects of the same color when given a set of colored items

name: Red in Multiple Contexts
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all red items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 red, 4 other colors);Child can identify that strawberries, fire trucks, and red blocks are all red;Child can name the color red when shown a strawberry and asked 'What color is this?'
description: Understanding red in multiple contexts: Child can select all red items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 red, 4 other colors)

name: Blue in Multiple Contexts
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all blue items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 blue, 4 other colors);Child can identify that blueberries, blue crayons, and clear daytime sky photos are all blue;Child can follow a direction using the color blue, such as 'Put the blue block in the box'
description: Understanding blue in multiple contexts: Child can select all blue items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 blue, 4 other colors)

name: Yellow in Multiple Contexts
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all yellow items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 yellow, 4 other colors);Child can identify that bananas, lemons, and school buses are all yellow;Child can name the color yellow when shown a yellow object and asked 'What color is this?'
description: Understanding yellow in multiple contexts: Child can select all yellow items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 yellow, 4 other colors)

name: Green in Nature and Food
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all green items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 green, 4 other colors);Child can identify that grass, leaves, and broccoli are all green;Child can follow a direction using the color green, such as 'Find something green in the room'
description: Understanding green in nature and food: Child can select all green items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 green, 4 other colors)

name: Orange in Food and Objects
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all orange items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 orange, 4 other colors);Child can identify that oranges (fruit), carrots, and pumpkins are all orange;Child can name the color orange when shown an orange object and asked 'What color is this?'
description: Understanding orange in food and objects: Child can select all orange items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 orange, 4 other colors)

name: Purple in Food and Objects
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all purple items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 purple, 4 other colors);Child can identify that grapes, eggplants, and purple crayons are all purple;Child can follow a direction using the color purple, such as 'Give me the purple marker'
description: Understanding purple in food and objects: Child can select all purple items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 purple, 4 other colors)

name: Black, White, and Brown
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can identify that tires, ants, and black crayons are black, while paper, milk, and white crayons are white;Child can identify that tree trunks, dirt, and teddy bears are brown;Child can sort a mixed set of black, white, and brown objects into three separate groups
description: Understanding black, white, and brown: Child can identify that tires, ants, and black crayons are black, while paper, milk, and white crayons are white

name: Pink and Gray
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can select all pink items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 pink, 4 other colors);Child can identify that elephants, clouds, and gray crayons are gray;Child can name the color pink when shown a pink object and asked 'What color is this?'
description: Understanding pink and gray: Child can select all pink items from a mixed set of 6 objects (2 pink, 4 other colors)

name: Two-Color Animals and Color Mixing
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Child can identify both colors present on zebras (black and white), ladybugs (red and black), or bumblebees (yellow and black) by pointing to each color when asked;Child can predict which color will result when mixing two paint colors by choosing from 3 options (e.g., 'What color do red and yellow make?');Child can demonstrate mixing two paint colors (red + yellow = orange, blue + yellow = green, or red + blue = purple) and name the resulting color
description: Understanding two-color animals and color mixing: Child can identify both colors present on zebras (black and white), ladybugs (red and black), or bumblebees (yellow and black) by pointing to each color when asked
